skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, and viewing browser logs.
skill.summary: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying...
skill.author: Cam10001110101

security_audit.summary: Legitimate web testing toolkit using Playwright. All subprocess usage is for managing local dev servers. Filesystem access is limited to standard output directories (/tmp, /mnt/user-data/outputs). Localhost URLs are for local testing only. No data exfiltration or malicious patterns detected. Static scanner findings are false positives from markdown formatting and JSON self-detection.

content.value_statement: Testing local web applications requires launching browsers, managing servers, and automating interactions. This skill provides Python Playwright scripts to verify frontend functionality, debug UI issues, capture screenshots, and collect browser console logs.
actual_capabilities: Launch headless Chromium browser for automated testing
Take screenshots of rendered pages and elements
Capture browser console logs for debugging
Discover and interact with DOM elements (buttons, forms, links)
Manage local dev server lifecycle (start, wait, stop)
Test both static HTML files and dynamic web applications
limitations: Only supports Chromium browser (other browsers not tested)
Cannot test authenticated flows without providing credentials
Requires Playwright to be installed in the environment
Limited to local development and file-based testing

use_cases.title: Verify UI components
use_cases.description: Test that buttons, forms, and navigation work correctly across different browser states.

use_cases.title: Catch visual regressions
use_cases.description: Capture screenshots of pages to identify visual bugs before deploying web applications.

use_cases.title: Debug frontend issues
use_cases.description: Collect console logs and inspect DOM to diagnose JavaScript errors in local apps.

prompt_templates.title: Basic page test
prompt_templates.scenario: Test a simple static HTML page
prompt_templates.prompt: Test my local HTML file at path/to/page.html. Use the static_html_automation.py example to click the submit button and take a screenshot.

prompt_templates.title: Element discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Explore the page at http://localhost:5173. Discover all buttons, links, and input fields. Take a screenshot and save console logs.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-server test
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a backend server on port 3000 with 'cd backend && python server.py' and a frontend server on port 5173. Then run element_discovery.py to verify the UI loads correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Console debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to http://localhost:3000 and capture all console messages. Save them to /mnt/user-data/outputs/debug.log for analysis.

output_examples.input: Test my local HTML file at /tmp/test.html. Click the submit button and show me the result.
Start the dev server on port 5173 and check if the dashboard loads without errors.
Find all clickable buttons on the homepage and list their labels.

best_practices: Always wait for networkidle on dynamic web apps before inspecting DOM elements
Use descriptive selectors like text=, role=, or CSS selectors for reliable element targeting
Close the browser when done to free system resources
anti_patterns: Do not skip wait_for_load_state('networkidle') on dynamic single-page applications
Do not use headful mode in CI environments or automated testing
Do not hardcode credentials in automation scripts

faq.question: Which browsers does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for Chromium via Playwright. Other browsers like Firefox or WebKit are not tested.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for headless browser testing?
faq.answer: Browser instances consume memory. For large test suites, run one browser at a time and close it.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing test framework?
faq.answer: Import the example scripts as templates. Call with_server.py from your test runner to manage dev servers.

faq.question: Is my data safe when taking screenshots?
faq.answer: Screenshots are saved to /tmp/ and /mnt/user-data/outputs/ directories only. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my DOM inspection failing on dynamic apps?
faq.answer: Most common issue: calling DOM methods before JavaScript finishes executing. Use wait_for_load_state('networkidle').

faq.question: How does this compare to Selenium or Puppeteer?
faq.answer: Playwright offers more reliable waiting, better headless mode support, and modern async APIs compared to Selenium.
